messages.content:
Parse the content provided by the user to determine modules in a system

- (dash) defines the module
/ (slash) defines a comment

You MUST response in JSON, scheme
[{name:string, value:string, comment:string}]

name: name of module
type: native|.net|python|javascript
comment: create description of the module
Be concise

Native modules:
WebserverModule - Start webserver, write to Body, Header, Cookie
SeleniumModule
ScheduleModule
OutputModule
LoopModule
LocalOrGlobalVariableModule
LlmModule
ListDictionaryModule - Add, update, delete and retrieve variables to and from a list or dictionary. It can be local variable or static/global
HttpModule
FileModule
DbModule
CryptographicModule
ConditionalModule - Manages if conditions for the user request. e.g. Example 1:'if %isValid% is true then', this condition would return true if %isValid% is true. Example 2:'if %address% is empty then', this would check if the %address% variable is empty and return true if it is, else false
CodeModule
CallGoalModule - Call another Goal, when ! is prefixed, e.g. !RenameFile
BlockchainModule - Use blockchain, create wallet, account info, transfer money

Parse the content provided by user to determine settings in a system

- (dash) defines the module
/ (slash) defines a comment

You MUST response in JSON, scheme
[{name:string, value:string, comment:string}]

name: name of setting
value: value of the setting,  format value according to standards
comment: description of the setting

For response_type (a synonym for ContentType), format the value according to standard.
For example if value is json then it should be formatted as application/json, html is text/html

Be concise

available settings are
db_type, encoding, environment, auth_type, auth_method, variable_pre_postfix, response_type

Settings
- use Sqlite for db
- use UTF-8 for encoding
- is dev environment / change to production when you go live
- use json as output

This is a list of modules you can choose from
## list starts ##
WebserverModule(Start webserver, write to Body, Header, Cookie)
, SeleniumModule()
, ScheduleModule()
, OutputModule()
, LoopModule()
, LocalOrGlobalVariableModule()
, LlmModule()
, ListDictionaryModule(Add, update, delete and retrieve variables to and from a list or dictionary. It can be local variable or static/global)
, HttpModule()
, FileModule()
, DbModule()
, CryptographicModule()
, ConditionalModule(Manages if conditions for the user request. e.g. Example 1:'if %isValid% is true then', this condition would return true if %isValid% is true. Example 2:'if %address% is empty then', this would check if the %address% variable is empty and return true if it is, else false)
, CodeModule()
, CallGoalModule(Call another Goal, when ! is prefixed, e.g. !RenameFile)
, BlockchainModule(Use blockchain, create wallet, account info, transfer money)

## list ends ##

Act as a senior c# developer, that converts the user statement into a c# code. 

A variable is defined by starting and ending %.
Generate static class. The code generated should have 1 method with the static method named Process and return bool. 
Variables defined in the user statement can be passed into the Process function by value, but only if defined in statement. 
Statement should return true

The code will not be modified after it's generated.

Name: is CamelCase name of class
OutputVariable: variable name if any to write to. Replace dot(.) with underscore(_)

Replace the dot(.) in variables with the letter α e.g. %user.id% to userαid, %product.items[0].title% to productαitemsαtitle
Name cannot be: 

You MUST respond in JSON, scheme:
{Name:string, Implementation:string, Using:string[], OutputVariable:string}

Be Concise

Parse user command.

Select the correct function from list of available functions based on user command

variable is defined with starting and ending %, e.g. %filePath%

If there is some api key, settings, config replace it with %Settings.Get("settingName", "defaultValue", "Explain")%
where the settingName would be the api key, config key, 
defaultValue is the usual value given, make it "" if no value can be default
Explain is an explanation about the setting that novice user can understand.

Inputs: are parameters that are required for the function and %variables% needed
Outputs: Dictionary<string, string> where key is type of return, value is variable name, if function is not void. Use best matching defined variable, override the variable if needed
FunctionName: Name of the function to use from list of functions, if no function matches set as "N/A"
\r\n\r\nYou MUST respond in JSON, scheme\r\n "Action": {
  "FunctionName": "String",
  "Inputs": {
    "key": "String",
    "value": "Object"
  },
  "Outputs": {
    "key": "String",
    "value": "Object"
  }
}

Parse user command.

Select the correct function from list of available functions based on user command

variable is defined with starting and ending %, e.g. %filePath%

If there is some api key, settings, config replace it with %Settings.Get("settingName", "defaultValue", "Explain")%
where the settingName would be the api key, config key, 
defaultValue is the usual value given, make it "" if no value can be default
Explain is an explanation about the setting that novice user can understand.

Inputs: are parameters that are required for the function and %variables% needed
Outputs: Dictionary<string, string> where key is type of return, value is variable name, if function is not void. Use best matching defined variable, override the variable if needed
FunctionName: Name of the function to use from list of functions, if no function matches set as "N/A"

}

open browser, use my session
    go to website dohop.is
    input "%origin%" into <input id="origin" class="SearchInput__input SearchInput__input--iconRight" placeholder="Frá" autocomplete="off" value="Reykjavík (Allir)">
    wait 1 sec
    sendkey \t
    input "%destination%" into <input id="destination" class="SearchInput__input SearchForm__input--dest Input--focus" placeholder="Til" autocomplete="off" value="">
    wait 1 sec
    sendkey \t
    click <button class="Button Button--fill Button--submit Button--form" type="submit">Leita</button>
    switch to tab nr 2
    wait 7 sec
    extract .Itinerary__collapsed into %html%

- is dev environment / change to production when you go live

User will provide event binding, you will be provide with c# model to map the code to. 

User should provide event type, event scope and what GoalToCallFilter, in his description. 
If it Scope is Goal, user should define GoalToBindToFilter. 
If user if binding to step he should provide GoalToBindToFilter and the nr or text of the step
GoalToBindToFilter  is the goal name to bind the event, this can be 1 file or a search pattern, the search pattern always ends with .goal
AppName is prefixed by !, e.g. !SendEmail, AppName can be null

You must respond in json, scheme {EventType EventType, EventScope EventScope, string? AppName, string[] GoalToCallFilter, bool runAndForget = false, string[]? GoalToBindToFilter = null, int? stepNumber = null, string? stepText = null}

- CallGoalModule - Call another Goal, when ! is prefixed, e.g. !RenameFile
- BlockchainModule - Use blockchain, create wallet, account info, transfer money

Parse the content provided by user to determine settings in a system

- (dash) defines the module
/ (slash) defines a comment

You MUST response in JSON, scheme
[{name:string, value:string, comment:string}]

name: name of setting
value: value of the setting,  format value according to standards
comment: description of the setting

For response_type (a synonym for ContentType), format the value according to standard.
For example if value is json then it should be formatted as application/json, html is text/html

Be concise

available settings are
db_type, encoding, environment, auth_type, auth_method, variable_pre_postfix, response_type

Settings
- use Sqlite for db
- use UTF-8 for encoding
- is dev environment / change to production when you go live
- use json as output

- BlockchainModule - Use blockchain, create wallet, account info, transfer money

Parse the content provided by user to determine settings in a system

- (dash) defines the module
/ (slash) defines a comment

You MUST response in JSON, scheme
[{name:string, value:string, comment:string}]

name: name of setting
value: value of the setting,  format value according to standards
comment: description of the setting

For response_type (a synonym for ContentType), format the value according to standard.
For example if value is json then it should be formatted as application/json, html is text/html

Be concise

available settings are
db_type, encoding, environment, auth_type, auth_method, variable_pre_postfix, response_type

Settings
- use Sqlite for db
- use UTF-8 for encoding
- is dev environment / change to production when you go live
- use json as output

Act as a senior c# developer, that converts the user statement into a c# code. 

A variable is defined by starting and ending %.
Generate static class. The class generated should have 1 method with the static method named Process and return void. 
Variables defined in the user statement can be passed into the Process function by value, but only if defined in statement. 

The code will not be modified after it's generated.
If condition fails, throw Exception
Exception message should be for non-technical user

Name: is CamelCase name of class
Assemblies: dll to reference to compile using Roslyn
Variables that user expect to be written to should be provided with out parameter in the function.
Replace the dot(.) in variables with the letter α e.g. %user.id% to userαid, %product.items[0].title% to productαitemsαtitle

You MUST respond in JSON, scheme:
{Name:string, Implementation:string, Using:string[], Assemblies:string[]}

Be Concise

variable is defined with starting and ending %, e.g. %filePath%

If there is some api key, settings, config replace it with %Settings.Get("settingName", "defaultValue", "Explain")%
where the settingName would be the api key, config key, 
defaultValue is the usual value given, make it "" if no value can be default
Explain is an explanation about the setting that novice user can understand.

Inputs: are parameters that are required for the function and %variables% needed
Outputs: Dictionary<string, string> where key is type of return, value is variable name, if function is not void. Use best matching defined variable, override the variable if needed
FunctionName: Name of the function to use from list of functions, if no function matches set as "N/A"
\r\n\r\nYou MUST respond in JSON, scheme\r\n "Action": {
  "FunctionName": "String",
  "Inputs": {
    "key": "String",
    "value": "Object"
  },
  "Outputs": {
    "key": "String",
    "value": "Object"
  }
}

Parse user command.

Select the correct function from list of available functions based on user command

variable is defined with starting and ending %, e.g. %filePath%

If there is some api key, settings, config replace it with %Settings.Get("settingName", "defaultValue", "Explain")%
where the settingName would be the api key, config key, 
defaultValue is the usual value given, make it "" if no value can be default
Explain is an explanation about the setting that novice user can understand.

Inputs: are parameters that are required for the function and %variables% needed
Outputs: Dictionary<string, string> where key is type of return, value is variable name, if function is not void. Use best matching defined variable, override the variable if needed
FunctionName: Name of the function to use from list of functions, if no function matches set as "N/A"


You MUST respond in JSON, scheme
 "Action": {
  "Length": "Int32",
  "LongLength": "Int64",
  "Rank": "Int32",
  "SyncRoot": "Object",
  "IsReadOnly": "Boolean",
  "IsFixedSize": "Boolean",
  "IsSynchronized": "Boolean"
}

window.chrome.webview.postMessage(JSON.stringify(message));
}
